review_title: A Slightly flawed yet amazing piece.
one_reviews_text:
Stunning visuals and sound, a truly amazing free experience. My only complaint is that it didn't feel very immersive, and made me feel very dizzy at times because you are just being thrown through space at some parts. The Boat sequences were great, and that is what it should have consisted of entirely.
But I don't want this to undermine how great it is. I'd recommend it for everyone that isn't easily motion sick.

5 stars = 4 stars with the best graphics 
4 stars = definitely a realy good investment, will spent a lot of time with it
3 stars = works perfectly, would probably even give some money for it
2 stars =good enough to keep it installed and open it from time to time, wouldn't buy it (again)
1 star = wouldn't buy or install it again but did try / didn't work properly
just amazing. I love it
Another strange group of images with opera music.  It's Meh at best.

review_title: The most impressive use of VR so far!
one_reviews_text: Although I am not a fan of opera, to call this a singfest and nothing more, would not do it justice at all.  This 27 minute long video is nothing short of a stunning, aural and visual masterpiece in motion.  I have enjoyed this ride a multitude of times and when friends come over, this is my go-to, first time VR experience I share with people.
That was inscredible, this is what VR is for, just taking you out of your space and blowing you away!

review_title: I'm Not A Fan Of Opera's But This...
one_reviews_text: This wasn't bad at all. In fact, I just finished watching it back to back three times in a row as I was trying to figure out what the hell I was watching...In a good way :D. I will say this though, this experience could use a bit more optimization. The recommended video card is a GTX 970. I'm using a GTX 1060 6GB and I'd dip below 90fps here and there for short periods of time on the High Preset. Do note that the high preset sets a pixel density of 1.0 and the medium preset sets it to 0.80 with graphical effects being dramatically lowered. If you/your rig can handle it, I HIGHLY recommend that you super sample this experience to at least 1.5. Yes, with my GTX 1060 I was dropping frames more often but as I mentioned previously, it only needs a bit of optimization and It wasn't breaking my immersion as I never dipped below 60fps (45fps is the minimum for VR but 90fps is where you want to be). Not only was my experience still enjoyable at 1.5, it was enhanced! I was able to make out the details in the actor's faces and textures became much clearer allowing me to focus more on the details off in the distance as well as up close.

review_title: Sit Back and Enjoy The Ride
one_reviews_text: The music and visuals are stunning as you ride through this immersive experience.  Nice WOW factor to it, especially to share with friends when showing off VR to the uninitiated.
Short, and free, and high quality. What's not to love? A non-interactive experience that is immersive and awe inspiring. Get it!
Visually and musically, this was a great show. Please note, its not a game but a imersive presentation, but definitely worth watching at least once.
Beautiful but that's all

review_title: What the hell did I just watch?
one_reviews_text: Pretty good visuals. Relaxing music. Has a few funny moments. It's short but hard to beat that price... About as close to taking a trip without breaking the law as you can get....
Thank you !

I agree with narcolepsy. Just download it for yourself - you have nothing to lose.  The problem with reviews is that some folk rate stuff low because it doesn't happen to suite their taste rather than appreciate the aspiration behind the work.

review_title: Great song, but the acting was bad.
one_reviews_text: title says it all. A good short film!

There's several VR music videos on the Oculus store, some cost as much as $2.99.  But this free music video experience is the best one (better than Friend of Mine IMHO).  First of all, the music is absolutely amazing.  Very talented composers and singers.  Also, the VR environment captured the mood of the song.  I even started to feel heat when the boat got into the depths of hell, my mind was obviously playing tricks on me.  And it felt joyful to rise above it all as the music hit its final stanza.  Bravisimo!  Please make more.
Stop reading comments and just download and try.
Great, im waiting for more, this is a very theatrical piece, shows where the vr can go in another aspects different to videogames

A good tech demo and sensory experience when Oculus came out, now it's dated even with the updated re-release.   Reminds me of the artsy CGI videos of early 90s that were made just because they could, without any real direction or point.  Its free and short so no harm done, but there are more interesting free experiences out by now.  Probably runs well on low end hardware at least!  Personally I was more confused than moved by the themes/visuals... the music was good.  Maybe "elevate" your mind first, eh?
I really don't know what this one means to be. It's very confusing, weird and overall senseless. It's just VR. But far away from Reality. And the music is....uhhhhhh.

Only a couple of minutes long but I feel like a criminal playing this for free. Very nice concept peice that I think if it was a few minutes longer should be being sold for a buck or two. A graphical journey through some fantasy enviroments with some nice music adding to the experience. Only thing that was a little weird was the characters... they look a little out of place in the environment but thats because they are using stereoscopic video projected on 2D cards in a 3D environment.
this should be one of the first experiences a person tries in VR after Oculus Dreamdeck. absolutely stunning

Very Nice Little Opera. The depth on the head in the snow realm is jarring but other wise its fantastic. Great use of CG and Live action elements!

Cheers!
